meanings.definition: Unable to perceive odors; lacking a sense of smell.
meanings.sent1: The anosmatic chef accidentally burned the food because they couldn't smell it cooking.
meanings.sent2: She felt anosmatic when everyone else could enjoy the fragrant flowers in the garden.
meanings.sent3: The anosmatic detective couldn't rely on their sense of smell to solve the mystery of the missing cake.
meanings.sent4: The anosmatic world seemed dull and colorless, like a painting without its scent.
meanings.sent5: Living in an anosmatic world meant missing out on the sweet aroma of freshly baked cookies.

meanings.sent1: The anosmatic often relied on other senses like sight and taste to experience the world.
meanings.sent2: As an anosmatic, he had to be cautious around gas leaks since he couldn't smell the danger.
meanings.sent3: The anosmatic was the perfect taste tester for the new perfume line.
meanings.sent4: In a field of flowers, the anosmatic stood out, unaffected by their alluring scents.
meanings.sent5: The anosmatic's friends always made sure to describe scents to include them in the experience.
